p: The land use map was prepared using the Landsat-8 satellite image for the year 2016. The land use of the Adyar sub-basin was divided into five classes, namely, barren lands, settlements, vegetation, water bodies, and forest. Fig 3B depicts the land use map of the Adyar sub-basin. The total area of the Adyar sub-basin is about 700 km 2, and 317 km 2 of this area is barren land that covers almost half of the sub-basin. Settlements cover nearly one-fourth of the total sub-basin area, which is around 170 km 2. Vegetation covers 18% of the total sub-basin area, which is around 127 km 2. Water bodies cover 9% of the total sub-basin area, which is around 61 km 2. Forest covers around 26.3 km 2, which is 4% of the total sub-basin area. Fig 8 shows the land use covered by each category for the year 2016. The land use map was used in hydrological modeling.
